Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

“Star Union citizens who survived did so at a tremendous cost to their sanity. While we slept in space, generations endured the collapse of society, constant starvation, cannibalism, the insanity of the ruptured Void, and poison in the earth and sky. How could a man recover whole? The short answer: they don’t. Spacers call their kettle-headed infantry Psychos. They fight over the last useful scraps of tech—anything they can use to get an advantage. In a pinch, they can turn violently mad at the flick of a switch.”—Senior Sanxus Bellows, “RV-481M: Aftermath and Anarchy”

“幸存下来的星际联盟公民，在理智层面上都做出了巨大的牺牲。当我们在太空中沉睡时，无数后代在已经崩塌的社会中苟延残喘、忍受饥饿、甚至吃掉同类。破碎的虚空，大地与空气中的毒素，都在剥夺着人们的理智。一个人类要如何修复这满目的疮痍？答案很简单：做不到。太空掠夺者称呼那些小脑袋的士兵为疯子。他们会为了任何能够派上用场的技术而战。身处险境时，他们会立刻变得歇斯底里起来。”- 桑修斯·比洛斯长官，“RV-481M：创伤与混乱”

“The Spacers were first to emerge from the forced peace created by the Star Union. When food was no longer treated to pacify people’s instincts, Spacer forefathers embraced their basest nature. They care nothing for aesthetics or civilization. Their only desires are the pleasure devices wherein they live out their cruel fantasies in virtual worlds. Without such devices, ironically, they become even more reckless. They’ll deliberately crash their trucks into enemies, laughing all the way. They think they’re in a shooting, driving game with or without their VR gaming gear.”—Anthropologist, Dr. Sarah Harkness, “RV-6012H: A Past of Twisted Purposes”

“太空掠夺者首次现身于星际联盟创建的力场空间中。那时食物已经无法安抚人类的本能，所以太空掠夺者的祖先们拥抱了最原始的本能，将美学与文明全部抛诸脑后。他们唯一想做的，就是沉浸在娱乐设备创造的虚拟世界中，满足自己的残暴幻想，从而获得愉悦。讽刺的是，就算离开了那些设备，他们的残忍也丝毫没有减少。他们会驾驶卡车，一路狂笑着冲向敌人。可能他们仍认为自己处在一个射击-驾驶游戏中吧。”- 人类学家萨拉·哈克尼斯博士，“RV-6012H：带有扭曲目标的过去”

“We approached a Spacer colony cautiously. Commander said many Spacers lived off junkyards when civilization collapsed. I wondered how that could be healthy. Then I saw a Melter. He was larger than normal. His distorted face looked like melted candlewax. His body was covered in rolls of fat that repelled the acid sloshing in containers on his back. He grinned, pointing a barrel-sized chemical sprayer at our Armored Tank. The acid ate through its armor. We fled on foot as he lobbed cannisters of corrosive gas at our backs.”—Ensign Ryland Grubell, “RV-1274M: Personnel Journal Entries”

“我们谨慎地接近了一处太空掠夺者殖民地。指挥官说当文明倒塌之后，许多太空掠夺者都生活在垃圾场里，我严重怀疑他们的健康问题。随后，我看到了一个融化者，他比一般人的体格大得多。他扭曲的面容看起来像个融化的蜡烛。他的身上挂满脂肪，它们可以有效阻挡从背后的容器中溅出的酸液。他狞笑着，用手中的管状化学物质发射器瞄准了我们的坦克，酸液直接腐蚀了它的护甲。我们立刻弃车逃跑，但他却朝着逃跑的我们扔了一些装有腐蚀性气体的罐头。”- 海军少尉里兰德·格鲁比尔，“RV-1274M：个人日志”

"I awoke to a loud boom. I jumped from my bunk and dashed from the barracks. The glow of flames lit the bunker wall. In the air screamed a hovering junkpile. It catapulted a fiery barrel. Radiant flames engulfed the armory. I trained my rifle on it. My shots reflected harmlessly off the heavy armor plating. The flying ship turned. The air was a wash of fire. I jumped into a retaining pond as spurts of liquid flame roiled over where I was standing. I understood why they called it a Hellcopter.” [br/]—Captain Addria Alethra, “RV-4468M: Encounters”[br/]

“巨大的爆炸声将我吵醒，我从床上一跃而下，以最快的速度冲出了军营。火焰已经点燃了地堡的墙壁。一个垃圾堆在空中呼啸着，它装备有一个可以喷射出火焰的枪管，产生的高温足以融化装甲。我用手中的步枪朝它射击，但却无法对它厚重的装甲板造成任何伤害。它掉头离开，留下一片火海。当液态火焰向我身边袭来，我纵身跳入了一个蓄水池中。现在我知道，它为什么有着地狱直升机这个名号了。”[br/]- 阿德里亚·阿勒希拉队长，“RV-4468M：遭遇战”[br/]

“Spacers travel the waters in what looks like a floating junk pile. The Junk Ship’s turrets shoot incendiary projectiles, and don’t be fooled by the rusted barrels that they launch at enemy ships. They are filled with an incendiary chemical that explodes with unquenchable fire. Away from their colony’s virtual debauchery simulators, Spacers become ferocious. If these cannibalistic savages can, they will act out their depraved fantasies on the sailors trapped onboard the vessels they board. My advice: Blow it up the moment you see it on the horizon.” —Lars ‘The Admiral’ Robinson, “RV-57682M: Restoring Order to the Sea”

“太空掠夺者的水上载具就像一个漂浮的垃圾堆。这种垃圾船的炮塔能够发射易燃物，千万不要小瞧这些表面满是腐化的桶子，里面装满了易燃物质，爆炸后就会引发大火。摆脱了殖民地虚假的道德束缚后，太空掠夺者们露出了凶残的本性，他们会竭尽所能地在那些被困的水手和被他们占领的船只身上将自己的残忍幻想变为现实。我的建议是，只要看到这种垃圾船，就立刻将其摧毁。”- 拉尔斯·“海军上将”·罗宾逊，“RV-57682M：恢复海上的秩序”

“A raving lunatic hologram hovered over a scrap-iron vehicle, bringing a crowd of Spacers. The image pointed at my Lieutenant. Madness swept over us. My psionic indicators buzzed a warning. The mad sermon was an attack. Before I could raise the alarm, the Spacers mobbed the Lieutenant. Foaming at the mouth, they ripped him apart. The Spacers planted the Lieutenant’s spine and skull to a pole that radiated mental fury. Inspired by their macabre creation and spurred on by the ramblings of their Mad preacher, the Spacers’ superhuman homicidal wrath amplified.”—Captain Ben Carter, “RV-5688M: Mutant Incident Reports.”

“一艘载满太空掠夺者的破烂载具上方漂浮着一个疯癫的全息影像。它朝着我的中尉而来。随后一股疯狂袭来，我的灵能指示器响起了警报。那段疯狂的布道其实是一次灵能打击。我还没来得及拉响警报，太空掠夺者们便将中尉团团围住，将其分而食之。太空掠夺者们将中尉的脊柱与头骨放入了一根能够致人疯狂的柱子中。有了这个可怖的发明和疯狂教士牧师的胡言乱语，太空掠夺者们本就超乎常人的杀戮欲望变得更加旺盛。”- 本·卡特队长，“RV-5688M：突发事件报告”

“I knew the skull on that post. He died trying to save his family. The Spacers see non-Spacers as resources. That skull gives them power. They tally their kills like life is a game. There is nothing so corrupted that they won’t try it. That skull on the post is a dare to whatever is decent in the world—to any gods that stands for what is decent—that Spacers do what they want. They are the embodiment of rebellion and an Effigy is how they see us.”—Nurse Rachel Greene, “RV-1806H: Observations of The Fallen”
“我认识柱子上的那个头骨，他曾为了拯救家人而牺牲。太空掠夺者们视异族为资源，头骨能够赐予他们力量。他们将人生视作一场杀戮的游戏，因此任何堕落的事物都敢尝试。柱子上的头骨就是他们向世界，向那些象征着正义的众神们发出的挑衅，太空掠夺者就是这么为所欲为。他们是叛逆的化身，在他们眼中，我们不过是‘雕像’。”- 蕾切尔·格里尼护士，“RV-1806H：观察逝者”
